info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 06 at 10:29AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River near Lavina affecting Golden Valley County. Musselshell River near Shawmut affecting Wheatland County. .The Musselshell river continues to flow near bankfull from Shawmut through Lavina, and the forecast keeps the river just below flood stage for the next several days. However, additional heavy rainfall is possible in this area, and any additional precipitation may push the river above minor flood stage at times over the next several days. In addition to the potential for minor flooding, significant bank erosion is likely with flows of this magnitude which may cause additional damage to infrastructure along the river. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Musselshell River near Lavina. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the river is possible. Significant erosion is likely at flows of this magnitude and may result in damage of infrastructure along the river as well as land loss. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - The river is nearly steady just below flood stage. The river will fluctuate near flood stage through the next few days with the potential to go above flood stage at times based on upstream precipitation. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Musselshell River Lavina 9.5 9.0 Tue 9 am 9.2 8.7 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon by 1230 PM MDT.
